Narratives.symptoms_management_of_pain: Yes - as described above I try to wear corset regularly and on "mild" days with a Bow Padded bib to feel without corset
Narratives.symptoms_freedom_of_movement: It can do as it is quite large. However when it starts becoming difficult I put on the binder
Narratives.symptoms_restriction_and_adaptation: It can restrict activities I get on with life by using a abdominal binder. I have tried many ones but finally found one I like. It allows me to run my dancing class too. Yes as above used abdominal binder/corset It helps me a lot but is difficult to wear in hot weather
Narratives.employment_financial_pressure: It would if I did not work but I use the binder & get on with it. I will consider not earning money, simply cannot afford not
Narratives.employment_return_to_work_issues: I dont let it affect my work as I cannot afford to not work
Narratives.body_image_changes_to_perceptions_of_sel: Definitely so I try to hide it by using my corset. I want to go out without it as otherwise it is quite visible and I feel it makes me obvious. I hate being seen by anyone in the street.
Narratives.body_image_fears_concerning_perceptions_: Oh definitely they do. If I dont have my corset & someone (someone like the post woman in my village) I can see they are quite shocked & want to ask but are being polite. It looks and somehow draws attention to it myself hence I use it. I have to do that and feel "here we go again". I hate that feeling of having to explain myself
Narratives.mental_health_emotional_responses: Yes it has. I used to be incredibly fit. Over time this has reduced and I feel twice old. It contributed greatly when I got a job that I considered "dummy job". Not giving dancing lessons. Mostly I could let it affect that. I did have feelings of low mood but have never been diagnosed to have depression.
Narratives.mental_health_coping_strategies: Not being able to act on feeling of "wanting" to give up being a dance teacher. I will forced me to face the situation. I think I am better adjusted to the situation and that is just how it is.
Narratives.interpersonal_relationships_changes_in_s: I have a supportive partner. Our relationship is one of companionship rather than intimacy
Narratives.interpersonal_relationships_difficulties: I try not to let it affect me. As I said I find my corset very helpful. I put it on & go out for activities. Social activities help me cope with the hernia a lot so I have to get myself out there & do what I like.
Narratives.SharedDecisionMaking_Questions: If anything can be done. Surgery will wall surgery be a high risk surgery. Will surgery fail again.
Narratives.SharedDecisionMaking_Hopes: that I am put on a waiting list for surgery
